alert.note: Alert for Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 08 at 6:06AM PST until January 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches in the valleys. Methow Valley to Mazama, snow accumulations up to 10 inches. Mountains above 4000 feet 8 to 20 inches, with highest amounts near Cascade Crest. Winds gusting as high as 20 mph in the valleys Tuesday. Mountain wind gusts up to 50 mph Tuesday. * WHERE...Methow, Loup Loup Pass, Twisp, Winthrop, Mazama, and Conconully. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact travel Monday evening through Wednesday. Gusty winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
